definition: to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)

sentences.english: China borders on the Pacific Ocean.
It's at this point that these three neighbourhoods adjoin.
sentences.chinese: 这三个街区在这一点毗连。

sentences.english: This piece of land abuts on a street.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地毗连着一条街。

sentences.english: The one end of the house butts on the lake.
The access road adjacent to the diamond hill funeral parlour leading to sze chen hall of diamond hill crematorium.
sentences.chinese: 毗连钻石山殡仪馆，通往钻石山火葬场思亲堂的通路。

sentences.english: Straight-through one-way valves installed in a connecting thread of the pipeline.
sentences.chinese: 直通式单向阀用罗纹毗连安装在管路上。

sentences.english: Green studs indicate the edge of any part of the carriageway at a road junction, layby or passing place.
sentences.chinese: 绿色路钉则设于毗连让车处及小路的入口车路边缘。
加利福尼亚州与太平洋毗连。

sentences.english: The two estates join at the foot of the hill.
sentences.chinese: 这两处房地产在山脚下相毗连。

sentences.english: Our stable abuts against his dwelling.
sentences.chinese: 我们的马厩和他的住所毗连。

sentences.english: The breadth of the contiguous zone is twelve nautical miles.
sentences.chinese: 毗连区的宽度为十二海里。

sentences.english: The stables adjoin the west wing of the house.
sentences.chinese: 牲口棚与房子的西翼毗连。

definition: to be located at/to be situated in
to look at one another/to face each other
to merge with/interlinking/to join with/to interlock
